intro: Psychotria alto-macahensis, commonly known as the highland Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. This plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Psychotria alto-macahensis is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its ecological significance in cloud forest ecosystems.
